name: Garden Work Time Calculator
description:
Hello, programmer of the Farmer's Company! You've got a task: you need to create a function that can determine when workers of different levels will finish their work.

In our garden, we have three types of trees:

```
'(-' represents an oak, which takes 2 hours to cut down.
'{-' represents a birch, which takes 1 hour to cut down.
'[-' represents a pine, which takes 3 hours to cut down.
```

We also have different teams:
```
Senior - works for 1 hour with no break.
Middle - works for 45-minute with a 15-minute break.
Junior - works for 1 hour with a 1 hour break.
```

Based on this data, you receive a string representing the plan of trees in your garden and the team working on it. Your task is to return the time it will take to finish the work.

For example:

```
howManyHours('(-{-(-', 'Senior') - result: '5 hour'
howManyHours('(-{-(-', 'Junior') - result: '10 hour'
howManyHours('(-{-(-', 'Middle') - result: '7 hour'
```

Any work time is rounded up to the nearest hour. For example, 6.6 hours will be rounded up to 7 hours.

Additionally, in case we receive an incorrect description of the garden, we need to handle the error:
```
howManyHours('{-{-[{-', 'Middle') - error
```
